b'For those who missed our Goa #ElectionsOnMyPlate special, it repeats Saturday 8 pm and Sunday 9 pm @IndiaToday . Fish, feni, football and yes, a bit of politics!\xf0\x9f\x98\x84 https://t.co/RhPMBmnvgr'

b'Net net: Goa stares at a hung assembly with Cong in pole position to be single largest with BJP also in race , esp if anti BJP vote splits badly. Post poll, cant rule out any coalition and defections. That\xe2\x80\x99s Goa for you: ajeeb state with gazab politics ! Next stop Punjab.. (10)'

b'Another X factor is Revolutionary Goans, a party that models itself on a Goa style MNS model of \xe2\x80\x98Goa for Goans\xe2\x80\x99. It\xe2\x80\x99s youthful candidates could take enough votes in a few constituencies to make a diff between victory and defeat. (9)'

b'AAP is X factor. In 2017, it won 6% vote and 38 of its 39 candidates lost their deposits. This time, it\xe2\x80\x99s vote share will climb and it will take votes from BOTH BJP and Cong. Can it win seats? Yes, but unclear how many. In Goa, AAP is seen as party of a growing \xe2\x80\x98change\xe2\x80\x99 vote (8)'

b'TMC campaign in Goa started off brightly but has faded in last month. Party is seen as an \xe2\x80\x98outsider\xe2\x80\x99 force. 4 months just isn\xe2\x80\x99t enough to win a state like Goa. There are limits to money power without a local connect. TMC can get 1 seat, if any at all.   (7)'

b'The smaller parties hold key to govt formation in Goa. MGP in alliance with TMC could win 3-4 seats and play key role in post poll politics. Goa Forward in alliance with Cong could win 1-2 seats. Post election MGP can go with any party that gives it a max share in power (6)'

b'Cong was single largest party in 2017 when anti incumbency against ruling party was much less. This time, Catholic vote could switch to Cong across Salcette belt of south Goa. if it picks up seats in north Goa,then it clearly is in a position to be the single largest party.  (6)'

b'Congress as largest oppn is obvious beneficiary of BJP\xe2\x80\x99s troubles. The entry of strongman @MichaelLobo76 is big boost to Cong in north Goa where it is weak. 15 of party\xe2\x80\x99s 17 MLAs left Cong after last election. Trust deficit is battle for Cong, its campaign machine weak. (5)'

b'BJP is losing Christian vote big time in 2022. 6 BJP Catholic MLAs have quit party in recent times. In 2012, BJP when the party won a majority in Goa for the first time, all its 6 Catholic MLAs won. In 2017, 7 won Christian popu in Goa is around 25% and key to 10-12 seats (4)'

b'BJP has put its eggs in strong individual candidates and not so much in traditional party structures. At least 10 candidates of BJP have the resources and local connect to win on their own strength. Plus BJP has max resources for last mile push (3)'

b'After 10 years in power, BJP is facing strong anti incumbency. Poor handling of Covid, corruption, job scams, unemployment have hit the Govt. BJP cadres are angry that party to quote one local karyakarta is \xe2\x80\x98Congressified\xe2\x80\x99. CM @DrPramodPSawant is \xe2\x80\x98face\xe2\x80\x99 of this discontent (2)'

b'So who will win Goa? Here is a thread: Goa has 40 constituencies, average size 25-30,000 votes. 8-10,000 votes is enough to win. Margins often less than a 1000 votes. This makes elections here transactional where every 500 votes \xe2\x80\x98Earned\xe2\x80\x99 count! Makes predictions tough (1)'
